CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 04-08-2016, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: PI BE asl eoiet Hee oe ea 2016/KER/34114 Cr1.MC.No. 3882 of 2016 APPENDIX PETITIONER (S)' ANNEXURES Al TRUE COPY CERTFIED COPY OF THE FINAL REPORT IN CRIME NO.335/2000 OF BEKAL POLICE STATION a2 TRUE COPY OF THE JUDGMENT DATED 25/6/2012 IN CC NO.343/2009 ON THE FILE FOT THE LEARNED JFCMC-II, HOSDURG a3 TRUE COPY OF THE CERTFIED COPY OF THE JUDGMENT DATED 14/3/2014 IN CRL.APPEAL NO.66/2013 ON THE FILE OF THE ADDL.SESSIONS JUDGE-II, KASARGOD. RESPONDENT (S) ' ANNEXURES NIL. / TRUE COPY / P.S. TO JUDGE Po 2016/KER/34114 RAJA VIJAYARAGHAVAN.YV, J Dated this the 4" day of August, 2016 ORDER 1.The petitioner is the accused in L.P.C. No.66 of 2013 on the file of the Judicial Magistrate of First Class Court-II, Hosdurg. 2.On his failure to appear before the learned Magistrate, non bailable warrant has been issued against him. The petitioner seeks for issuance of appropriate directions to the learned Magistrate to consider his application for recall of warrant and grant of bail on the date of surrender itself and to grant him bail. 3.It is submitted by the learned counsel for the petitioner that the co-accused has been acquitted after trial by Annexure-A3 judgment dated 14.3.2014 in Crl.Appeal No.145 of 2012. 2016/KER/34114 Cr.M.C.3882/2016 2 4.It was owing to the contumacious conduct of the petitioner, that Non Bailable Warrant was issued against him to secure his presence before the court below. This court in exercise of powers under Section 482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure will not be justified in interfering with the discretion of the learned Magistrate in granting bail. 5.It is for the petitioner to approach the learned Magistrate and appraise the reasons for his absence and to seek for recalling the warrant and grant of bail. There is no reason for this Court to assume that the learned Magistrate will not exercise his discretion judicially and in accordance with law. 6.In the result, the petitioner is directed to surrender before the trial court within 2 weeks from the date of this order and prefer application for recall of warrant and also for grant of bail with advance notice to the 2016/KER/34114 Crl.M.C.3882/2016 3 prosecutor concerned. In that event the learned Magistrate is directed to consider and dispose of the said application, uninfluenced by the pendency of the warrant, preferably on the same day itself, on its merits and in accordance with law. Coercive proceedings , if any shall be kept in abeyance till then. Petition is disposed off as above. Sd/- RAJA VIJAYARAGHAVAN.Y. JUDGE vps
